physical_appearance:This is a black-and-white photograph. It features a man
 standing on the left of a large caladium plant. The root of the plant is bordered by a patch of ferns. The man is holding a long object on his left shoulder
 and is dressed in a long sleeved top
 pants
 and wrap cloth around his waist.

sgcool_label_text:\This carte de visite photograph of a calladium plant at Tanglin was taken by August Sachtler
 a German photographer who started photographing in Singapore in the early 1860s. The studio details inscribed on the back of these cartes de visite read \\A. Sachtler in Singapore\\

metadata.title_text: A Calladium - Tanglin, Singapore Photograph of man by Caladium plant at Tanglin
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It features a man, standing on the left of a large caladium plant. The root of the plant is bordered by a patch of ferns. The man is holding a long object on his left shoulder, and is dressed in a long sleeved top, pants, and wrap cloth around his waist.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Carte de visite photographs Photographs Indigenous people Ethnic costume Tanglin (Singapore) Caladium
metadata.sgcool_label_text: "This carte de visite photograph of a calladium plant at Tanglin was taken by August Sachtler, a German photographer who started photographing in Singapore in the early 1860s. The studio details inscribed on the back of these cartes de visite read ""A. Sachtler in Singapore""
